description.narrative: The UNJP aims to further the rights of all persons with disabilities (PwDs) in Viet Nam, focusing on women and girls and under-represented PwDs.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: • # participants from OPDs and government partners, UN agencies and CSO attended training on the CRPD and SDGs • # of trainings for OPDs on the Marrakesh Treaty and the new Law on Intellectual Property, feedback mechanisms for Viet Nam’s laws and policies developed and delivered to enhance OPDs’ contributions to the review of LPD, using the CRPD to evaluate the NSEDP (2021-2025). • # of participants from OPDs attend trainings on the Marrakesh Treaty and the new Law on Intellectual Property, feedback mechanisms for Viet Nam’s laws and policies reporting increased knowledge or capacity to design or revise policies or systems to be more disability inclusive. • # and % of participants of trainings on the Marrakesh Treaty and the new Law on Intellectual Property, feedback mechanisms for Viet Nam’s laws and policies reporting increased knowledge or capacity to design or revise policies or systems to be more disability inclusive. • # of OPDs benefitted from capacity building activities (trainings on the Marrakesh Treaty and the new Law on Intellectual Property, feedback mechanisms for Viet Nam’s laws and policies) funded by UNPRPD programmes to strengthen the capacity of organizations of persons with disabilities. • # of capacity building activities (trainings on the Marrakesh Treaty and the new Law on Intellectual Property, feedback mechanisms for Viet Nam’s laws) funded by UNPRPD programmes, directed at women and girls with disabilities on their rights and requirements and/or directed at underrepresented groups of persons with disabilities on their rights and requirements • # of trainings for local NCD staff on the coordination of the Law revision process and MOCST officials, lawyers, librarians, educators and publishers on the Marrakesh Treaty and copyright exceptions to protect access to information rights of PwDs developed and delivered in the UNPRPD programme • # of participants who are local NCD staff and MOCST officials, lawyers, librarians, educators and p
